snippet: Seventeen nonprofits sent a letter to the Treasury Department asking it to require the real estate industry to screen buyers for money-laundering risk.
abstract: Seventeen nonprofit organizations send letter to Treasury Dept urging it to require that real estate industry verify the identities of buyers and screen them for potential money-laundering risk; request repeal of a 2002 temporary exemption from provisions of the Patriot Act that was granted to real estate industry; letter cites New York Times series Towers of Secrecy.
lead_paragraph: Seventeen nonprofits sent a letter to the Treasury Department asking it to require the real estate industry to screen buyers for money-laundering risk.

headline.main: Treasury Urged to Scrutinize Foreign Real Estate Buyers for Money-Laundering Risk
headline.print_headline: Treasury Urged to Scrutinize Foreign Real Estate Buyers for Money-Laundering Risk
